MYP Command Terms.Annotate: Add brief notes to a diagram or graph.
MYP Command Terms.Apply: Use knowledge and understanding in response to a given situation or real circumstances. Use an idea, equation, principle, theory or law in relation to a given problem or issue.
MYP Command Terms.Calculate: Obtain a numerical answer showing the relevant stages in the working.
MYP Command Terms.Classify: Arrange or order by class or category.
MYP Command Terms.Comment: Give a judgment based on a given statement or result of a calculation.
MYP Command Terms.Compare: Give an account of the similarities between two (or more) items or situations, referring to both (all) of them throughout.
MYP Command Terms.Compare and contrast: Give an account of the similarities and differences between two (or more) items or situations, referring to both (all) of them throughout.
MYP Command Terms.Construct: Display information in a diagrammatic or logical form.
MYP Command Terms.Contrast: Give an account of the differences between two (or more) items or situations, referring to both (all) of them throughout.
MYP Command Terms.Create: To evolve from oneâ€™s own thought or imagination, as a work or an invention.
MYP Command Terms.Critique: Provide a critical review or commentary, especially when dealing with works of art or literature.
MYP Command Terms.Deduce: Reach a conclusion from the information given.
MYP Command Terms.Define: Give the precise meaning of a word, phrase, concept or physical quantity.
MYP Command Terms.Demonstrate: Make clear by reasoning or evidence, illustrating with examples or practical application.
MYP Command Terms.Derive: Manipulate a mathematical relationship to give a new equation or relationship.
MYP Command Terms.Describe: Give a detailed account or picture of a situation, event, pattern or process.
MYP Command Terms.Design: Produce a plan, simulation or model.
MYP Command Terms.Develop: To improve incrementally, elaborate or expand in detail. Evolve to a more advanced or effective state.
MYP Command Terms.Differentiate: Obtain the derivative of a function.
MYP Command Terms.Discuss: Offer a considered and balanced review that includes a range of arguments, factors or hypotheses. Opinions or conclusions should be presented clearly and supported by appropriate evidence.
MYP Command Terms.Distinguish: Make clear the differences between two or more concepts or items.
MYP Command Terms.Document: Credit sources of information used by referencing (or citing) following a recognized referencing system. References should be included in the text and also at the end of the piece of work in a reference list or bibliography.
MYP Command Terms.Draw: Represent by means of a labelled, accurate diagram or graph, using a pencil.
MYP Command Terms.Estimate: Obtain an approximate value for an unknown quantity.
MYP Command Terms.Evaluate: Make an appraisal by weighing up the strengths and limitations.
MYP Command Terms.Examine: Consider an argument or concept in a way that uncovers the assumptions and interrelationships of the issue.
MYP Command Terms.Explain: Give a detailed account including reasons or causes.
MYP Command Terms.Explore: Undertake a systematic process of discovery.
MYP Command Terms.Find: Obtain an answer showing relevant stages in the working.
MYP Command Terms.Formulate: Express precisely and systematically the relevant concept(s) or argument(s).
MYP Command Terms.Hence: Use the preceding work to obtain the required result.
MYP Command Terms.Otherwise: It is suggested that the preceding work is used, but other methods could also receive credit.
MYP Command Terms.Identify: Provide an answer from a number of possibilities. Recognize and state briefly a distinguishing fact or feature.
MYP Command Terms.Integrate: Obtain the integral of a function.
MYP Command Terms.Interpret: Use knowledge and understanding to recognize trends and draw conclusions from given information.
MYP Command Terms.Investigate: Observe, study, or make a detailed and systematic examination, in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
MYP Command Terms.Justify: Give valid reasons or evidence to support an answer or conclusion.
MYP Command Terms.Label: Add a title, labels or brief explanation(s) to a diagram or graph.
MYP Command Terms.List: Give a sequence of brief answers with no explanation.
MYP Command Terms.Measure: Obtain a value for a quantity.
MYP Command Terms.Organize: Put ideas and information into a proper or systematic order.
MYP Command Terms.Outline: Give a brief account or summary.
MYP Command Terms.Plot: Mark the position of points on a diagram.
MYP Command Terms.Predict: Give an expected result of an upcoming action or event.
MYP Command Terms.Present: Offer for display, observation, examination or consideration.
MYP Command Terms.Prioritize: Give relative importance to, or put in an order of preference.
MYP Command Terms.Prove: Use a sequence of logical steps to obtain the required result in a formal way.
MYP Command Terms.Select: Choose from a list or group.
MYP Command Terms.Show: Give the steps in a calculation or derivation.
MYP Command Terms.Show that: Obtain the required result (possibly using information given) without the formality of proof.
MYP Command Terms.Sketch: Represent by means of a diagram or graph. The sketch should give a general idea of the required shape or relationship, and should include relevant features.
MYP Command Terms.State: Give a specific name, value or other brief answer without explanation or calculation.
MYP Command Terms.Suggest: Propose a solution, hypothesis or other possible answer.
MYP Command Terms.Summarize: Abstract a general theme or major point(s).
MYP Command Terms.Synthesize: Combine different ideas in order to create new understanding.
MYP Command Terms.To what extent: Consider the merits or otherwise of an argument or concept.
MYP Command Terms.Trace: Follow and record the action of an algorithm.
MYP Command Terms.Use: Apply knowledge or rules to put theory into practice.
MYP Command Terms.Verify: Provide evidence that validates the result.
MYP Command Terms.Write down: Obtain the answer(s), usually by extracting information. Little or no calculation is required.
